skill.name: feature-dev-complete
skill.description: Complete feature development lifecycle from research to deployment. Uses Gemini Search for best practices, architecture design, Codex prototyping, comprehensive testing, and documentation generation. Full 12-stage workflow.
skill.summary: Complete feature development lifecycle from research to deployment. Uses Gemini Search for best prac...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill. The SKILL.md file contains YAML frontmatter and markdown documentation describing a 12-stage development workflow. No executable code, scripts, or network operations exist. The shell script examples are purely illustrative documentation.

content.value_statement: Building features manually is slow and error-prone. This skill orchestrates multi-model AI to research, design, prototype, test, and document features in a complete 12-stage workflow.
actual_capabilities: Research latest best practices using Gemini Search
Analyze existing codebase patterns and architecture
Design system architecture with Claude Architect
Generate architecture diagrams and flow charts
Prototype code with Codex Auto and auto-fix iterations
Run comprehensive tests with theater detection and quality audits
limitations: Requires access to Gemini, Claude, and Codex models
May need user input for ambiguous design decisions
Cannot make deployment decisions without human approval

use_cases.title: Rapid feature delivery
use_cases.description: Ship complete features with research, code, tests, and docs in one workflow

use_cases.title: Architecture standardization
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent patterns across features with automated quality gates

use_cases.title: CI/CD integration
use_cases.description: Automated PR creation with comprehensive reports and deployment readiness checks

prompt_templates.title: Basic feature request
prompt_templates.prompt: Use feature-dev-complete to build [feature description] in [target directory]

prompt_templates.title: Feature with options
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop [feature] with custom settings: target=[directory], create_pr=[true/false], deploy_after=[true/false]

prompt_templates.title: Full pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Run feature-dev-complete for [feature] and create a PR with full documentation and test coverage report

prompt_templates.title: Complex system feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute complete feature lifecycle for [complex feature] including architecture diagrams, security review, and production readiness certification

output_examples.input: Use feature-dev-complete to build user authentication with JWT
output: âœ“ Research: Best practices for JWT auth (2025)
âœ“ Architecture: REST API with token refresh flow
âœ“ Diagrams: System architecture + data flow
âœ“ PR created with full documentation

best_practices: Provide clear feature specifications with acceptance criteria
Specify target directory to integrate with existing codebase structure
Review architecture design before prototyping phase for complex features
Set quality thresholds appropriately for your project standards
anti_patterns: Using vague feature descriptions that lead to ambiguous implementations
Skipping the research phase when building features for unfamiliar domains
Ignoring security scan results to meet deadline pressures
Not reviewing auto-generated tests for edge case coverage

faq.question: What models does this skill use?
faq.answer: Orchestrates Gemini for research and diagrams, Claude for architecture and testing, and Codex for rapid prototyping and auto-fixing.

faq.question: What are the 12 stages?
faq.answer: Research, codebase analysis, swarm initialization, architecture design, diagram generation, prototyping, theater detection, testing, style polish, security review, documentation, and production readiness.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my codebase?
faq.answer: Specify a target directory parameter. The skill copies completed implementation files and runs git operations automatically.

faq.question: Is my code safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill. It orchestrates other AI tools but does not execute arbitrary code or access credentials.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail?
faq.answer: Codex attempts auto-fix for 5 iterations. If issues persist, the workflow halts and requests manual intervention.

faq.question: How does this compare to coding agents?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured full-lifecycle approach rather than single-turn coding. It includes research, documentation, and quality gates that coding agents typically lack.
